block.p: 1. A theory says moods may be created by muscles used in facial expression. Unhappy expressions tighten sets of muscles that tend to heat the blood that flows to the brain, while smiles tighten muscles that cool the blood that flows to the brain.
2. For the first time in 14 years, the United States did not dominate an economic summit conference.
3. The results of that second survey will be compared with the results of the regular census to determine who was counted correctly, who was counted improperly, and who was not counted.
4. Planting enough trees around the world to halt global warming. Trees absorb carbon dioxide, the gas chiefly responsible for the phenomenon, and they emit oxygen.

5. The legislation involved would ban talks with P.L.O. members tied to terrorism. It was prompted by American discussions with Saleh Khalef, Yasir Arafat's principal deputy in the P.L.O. He is also a founder and leader of Black September, the terrorist organization that carried out the massacre of Israelis at the Olympic Games in Munich in 1972.
6. Nearly $11 million in backing and support from corporate sponsors and a commitment for five television network specials.
7. The Oregon Lottery Commission instituted weekly betting on National Football League games, the first state lottery to involve professional team sports.
8. Just about every candidate supports military-style work camps for criminals.
9. The National Film Preservation Board selected the first 25 films that will have Congressional protection. The public will be warned if any are significantly altered.
10. The Solidarity delegates reduced the number of Communist defections by forcing a voting procedure that required signed individual ballots and publication of the votes of individual members.
11. A second measles vaccination for everyone under the age of 32. One aspirin every other day for healthy men over 50, to reduce the risk of heart attack.
12. Mr. Cheney said the decision to broaden the range of personal computers that can be sold to Soviet-bloc nations would significantly benefit the Soviet military.
13. Mr. Bush offered no estimate of the cost of the space ventures and set no timetable for carrying them out.
14. The N.F.L. owners voted to go international with a new spring league that would have teams in Canada Europe, Mexico and the United States.
15. The burning of Kenya's stockpile of elephant tusks was a gesture to persuade the world to halt the ivory trade.
